text: in this video we're going to be talking
about the exciting new research on
longevity and how to extend your life
and stay healthy into old age you've
probably heard about billionaires
freezing themselves taking hundreds of
pills a day or injecting the blood of
young people now we're not saying this
can't work but I want to break down how
anyone can get most of the benefits of
fancy treatments and medications without
the risks by covering the basics we'll
be focusing on diet exercise and stress
management first why do humans age it's
obviously very complicated but basically
aging happens because of gradual wear
and tear on our bodies like a car that's
been running for 20 years eventually the
cells in our bodies won't work as
smoothly anymore they get more and more
damaged and can't repair themselves as
well as When We Were Young this happens
for three reasons genetics some people
are simply born with genes that mean
they don't age as quickly as other
people background cell damage
every day our cells are exposed to
things like pollution and UV ray which
cause damage this adds up over time and
the most important part Lifestyle the
choices we make about how we eat move
and manage stress have a huge impact on
how we age now we can't control our
genes or the pollution around us but we
can control how our genes are expressed
through our habits our lifespan is not
written in the stars here's what we can
do number one diet research shows that
there are three main things we can
change about our diet to increase our
lifespan intermittent fasting studies
consistently show that when we restrict
the amount of food mice are allowed to
eat in lab settings they are generally
healthier and live roughly 30% longer
the same has been found in other
organisms intermittent fasting isn't
about what you eat and it's not a fad
diet it's actually very simple it's
eating so that the gap between your
first meal and last fast meal is only 6
8 or 10 hours as opposed to 12 or 14
hours or more people often find it
easiest to skip breakfast but you can
also stop eating earlier before you go
to bed the great thing about
intermittent fasting is that while it
can be a challenge in the beginning your
body quickly adapts and you won't want
to go back when we fast what we're
really doing is telling the body that
now is not the time to go forth and
multiply it's time to conserve your
resources repair things better fight
free radicals and repair broken DNA
which is why it's so powerful eat diets
highend plants in the early 2000s a
journalist named Dan Butner went on an
expedition to find out where people
lived the longest and how they did it he
identified a handful of places from
around the world where people often
lived much longer than other populations
he called them blue zones even though
people living in the different blue
zones differed in lots of ways they all
shared some things in common the main
one was that they all ate diets high in
Plants they ate lots of vegetables
fruits beans whole grains and only a
little meat and dairy with lots of
healthy fats like avocado and olive oil
they also didn't eat too much only
eating until they were 80% full they
would eat with other people and didn't
drink too much alcohol all contributing
to their long lives avoid ultr processed
foods in 2024 a groundbreaking study was
published That Shook the health and
nutrition World it looked at ultr
processed foods foods that are packaged
and factory made with lots of unnatural
ingredients added to them it tracked
over 500,000 adults for nearly 23 years
and uncovered a startling connection the
participants who ate lots of ultr
processed foods had lives 10% shorter
and it wasn't only that they died
earlier the people in the study who ate
more processed Meats sugar and other
Ultra processed foods had unhealthier
lives with more heart disease diabetes
and obesity and because these foods are
high in calories but don't contain many
essential nutrients it's possible to be
overweight but actually starving for
nutrition the second thing we can do is
exercise now what if I told you that for
every hour of exercise you do you live 2
hours longer it sounds hard to believe
but it's actually what science tells us
studies also show that just 15 minutes
of exercise a day could add 3 years to
your life and 150 minutes of exercise a
week makes you 22% less likely to die
early if you go beyond 150 minutes that
number jumps to 35% scientists have
known about the benefits of exercise for
longevity for decades but we're finding
out recently that it's even better than
we previously thought why is exercise so
great for us you can think of your heart
and lungs as like the engines that power
your life and keep you alive when we do
exercise that increases our heart rate
and gets our blood pumping through our
veins we're strengthening our engine and
the stronger it is the longer it keeps
working but remember it's not all about
cardio strength training plays an
equally vital role sure lifting weights
can help you look great but it's also
one of the best defenses against the
effects of Aging one of the most
underrated benefits of exercise is How
It prepares your body for the Long Haul
it's not just about being fit today it's
about future proofing yourself for the
inevitable changes of Aging to come even
Elite athletes can escape this reality
their incredible performance at 30
simply isn't possible at 90 decline is
inevitable but here's where exercise
becomes your secret weapon building
buffer room if you think of it like
creating extra reserves of Fitness to
cushion that decline by building Your
Capacity now you're essentially banking
Fitness for the future a key part of
this is something called V CO2 Max a
measure of how efficiently your heart
and lungs deliver oxygen to your muscles
it's one of the best indicators of your
overall Fitness and a powerful predictor
of how well you'll handle aging if
you're in your 30s or 40s working on a
high V2 Max isn't just about running
faster or lifting heavier today it's
about ensuring that decades from now
you'll still be able to climb stairs
carry groceries or enjoy the freedom of
movement exercise today is an investment
in your future so where can we start if
you don't exercise right now I'd say
don't worry most people don't the good
news is that it's never too late to
start as with everything it's best to
start slowly don't sign up for a
marathon if you've never run a mile
before begin with something easy and
manageable and work up over time you
also shouldn't rely on Willpower alone
to get you to the gym or Sports field
take exercise seriously make an
appointment and stick to it exercise is
hard but remember that you'll always be
grateful for how it pays off in the long
run the final area of longevity research
we're exploring is stress stress is not
just a bad feeling it has physical
consequences and can speed up the aging
process in 2021 researchers at Yale used
something called the appropriately named
Grim age clock a scientific tool that
tracks biological aging much more
precisely than older tools this wasn't a
normal study but a deep dive into how
stress affects our bodies at a the
cellular level the study found that men
lose roughly 2.8 years of life if
they're constantly stressed and women
lose around 2.3 years the reason stress
is so bad is that it keeps our fight or
flight system turned on for too long
this system was designed to help us in
emergencies by releasing stress hormones
like cortisol and adrenaline they help
us in short bursts but harm us when they
stay for too long high cortisol damages
our cells and even shortens the
protective caps on our DNA called telr
as our telr wear down our cells age
faster and we're more likely to develop
chronic diseases so what can we do about
stress the researchers at Yale
identified two powerful psychological
tools to protect us from stress aging us
emotion regulation instead of letting
anger anxiety or any other negative
feeling spiral we should cultivate the
ability to pause and shift our
perspective this would protect us from
stress self-control this keeps us
grounded and helps us not rely on
unhealthy coping mechanisms when we're
stressed like overeating which
ultimately makes us more stressed in the
long run and damages our health there
are many easy practical ways to reduce
stress you can practice yoga or
meditation exercise regularly learn
breathing exercises or whatever helps
you take a step back and reset every
time you choose a strategic response to
stress you're potentially adding quality
years to your life
there was a lot of information in this
